name: Secret Garden Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: We (couple plus 17 y/o daughter) stumbled upon this beautiful place and had lunch. Potstickers, cucumber salad, egg vegetable fried rice! Delicious ! Tanya is wonderful! An amazing place! Beautiful place in a secluded spot. Please go, it's great!
reviews.title: Amazing lunch that we found by walking

reviews.text: We visited the Secret Garden during Chinese New Year and loved the hotel, the food and the setting. The management and staff are fantastic and it is a welcome reprieve from Guilin and Yangshuo town. It is convenient enough to town to access bars and restaurants but far enough away to feel the solitude of rural Chinese life.
reviews.title: Fantastic place in a beautiful rural setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated in a rural area of Souther China, the Secret Garden provides an interesting, unusual and beautiful environment whilst only some 17 minutes by an efficient and inexpensive taxi service to the attractive town of Yangshuo. The host, Fay is an extremely warm and welcoming person and these guests immediately felt at home in the charming, renovated stone building whist the courtyard provides a lovely setting for breakfast. On the subject of food we were more than pleasantly surprised by the quality of cooking but with hindsight given that much of the produce was very local it may be expected. We concentrated on the Chinese fare but the menu of Western food seemed more than adequate. We enjoyed the sleeping accommodation and overall the venue is highly recommended
reviews.title: A Unique Experience

reviews.text: This boutique hotel truly is unlike anywhere we have stayed before. Gorgeous buildings, lovingly renovated, in a picturesque location. It's not often that I would rate a hotel as the highlight of my trip, but this was everything we dared to hope for. Whilst we relaxed in the beautiful courtyard our kids raced around exploring the amazing buildings and gardens. It was hard to tear ourselves away for a bit of sightseeing at nearby attractions.
reviews.title: Highlight of our trip

reviews.text: Staying at the Secret Garden was a unique and very special experience that far exceeded our expectations. The hotel is set in breathtaking scenery in a traditional stone courtyard building in a rural village. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful, and the building has been beautifully and sympathetically restored. You really feel in harmony with your surroundings, a visitor rather than a tourist. The view is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen, and only a short walk from the river where you can take a raft or ride a bike - there is so much to see and do. The old village is surrounded by rice paddies and fish ponds with ducks, kumquat and pomelo orchards, rows of neatly planted vegetables, chilli bushes and fruit trees. The food at the hotel is fantastic, wonderful breakfasts with fresh ingredients and home cooking, and at night some of the most delicious Chinese food I have eaten, especially the spicy Sichuan dishes. The rooms themselves were tasteful, spacious and very comfortable, and toasty warm even though it was just a few degrees outside. The owner was so helpful in arranging taxis for us into nearby Yangshuo and in recommending places to walk and visit. We visited in the down season, when it was very cold, but we would love to return in warmer weather. Altogether one of the loveliest short breaks I have ever taken.
reviews.title: Very highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It hammered down with torrential rain almost the whole time and combined with very high temperatures, it was not always that pleasant and our clothes were always damp.
reviews.title: Wonderful ambience, very friendly people

reviews.text: The hotel is so delightful though and the setting is beyond beauty. We walked a great deal ( just had a knee op so cycling was forbidden) and our walks were the most delicious ever anywhere in the World. Sitting by a lake surrounded by those amazing limestone peaks, listening to the birdsong and the noise of the frogs and toads and fish surrounded by such stunning scenery. Could not be bettered.
reviews.title: the best relax and beautiful nature
Unique and wonderful experience
reviews.text: This hotel provides a unique opportunity to experience Chinese rural village life in a stunning setting and great accommodation. Faye is a wonderful host and makes sure you enjoy your stay with members of her team. The restaurant serves up excellent Chinese and western food. Highly recommended.

This was a wonderful, extremely comfortable place to stay in the middle of rice paddies. The staff speaks English, and we relied on them to make arrangements for all of our outings. Peter took us on a long bike ride in the countryside with a hike to Moon Hill. He was great! The hotel is lovely in a setting off the beaten path. Photos do not do it justice! We stayed 4 nights, just the right amount of time to see the area and Yangshuo. We were really glad we stayed outside town, which was noisy and busy. Also, the food at Secret Garden was excellent, better than restaurants in Yangshuo, and less expensive.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was spacious, clean (crisp sheets) and comfortable (especially the bed). Setting was totally unique - couldn't stop taking photos. Staff spoke english. The best bit was the breakfast - possibly the best in rural China! Excellent coffee, a great choice on the menu and items were prepared as you'd expect them to be (home from home). Wonderful place - peaceful, calm, full of history. We only had 2 nights there - a week would have been ideal. Commendable endevour on the part of the owner.
reviews.title: Unforgettable - hard to leave!

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights recently. The hotel is a refurbished house in an old village surrounded by karsts and paddy fields.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. They helped arrange drivers and activities. I highly recommend this place, particularly for people who want to get away from the more touristy Yangshou. If you are looking for something a little different and want a taste of rural China this is the place to go.
reviews.title: Peace and quiet during the Chinese October Holiday
Perfect Easter break
reviews.text: We had a great trip to Guilin and Yangshuo over Easter 2013, with 4 nights at the Secret Garden. It did not take long for Faye and team to make our family (3 children- 9, 7 and 5) to feel at home in this small hotel. The food was great with a mixture of Chinese and western food so there was something for everyone. The hotel is in a small village about 15 minute drive out of Yangshuo, which was pretty quiet and with no tv in the hotel, we kept the kids amused with cards and other games. The Secret Garden was a great base for exploring the Yangshou area.

We were very happy that we could book at least one night in this beautiful hotel in a historical building with super friendly staff. It was an experience to never forget. The rooms are so clean and tidy and so cute. The atmosphere so cosy. It was our starting point to discover the area by bike. The restaurant dishesbare excellent and they serve a variety of drinks. Top !
reviews.title: Peaceful place to enjoy.
Stunningly Serene
reviews.text: While off the beaten track, this hotel represents what traveling to remote China is all about. Rather than staying in town, this is a much preferred location if you are one to some tranquility, waking up in the morning to birds chirping and cockerels crowing.

Secret Garden exudes the old China rustic charm of village living but with modern day amenities. Faye and her staff are wonderful hosts, always ready to ensure that their guests are comfortable. Most reviewers have shared their experiences so I won't bore you with details...except to share with you photos of the hotel and its beautiful surrounding landscapes. Without doubt this is definitely a place to stay while in Yangshuo.
reviews.title: Perfect And Enchanting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Faye, Ian, Peter, Tanya, Lulu and everyone at Secret Garden for a memorable and pleasant stay. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in tranquil setting

description: Secret Garden is a boutique hotel with restaurant and art gallery, near the Yulong River in the beautiful Yangshuo countryside. We aim to preserve the beautiful Ming Dynasty buildings of this rural village; conserve the surrounding environment; and help develop the local community. If you are looking for a unique and inspirational environment in which to relax or explore, the Secret Garden Boutique Hotel is the perfect place for you.
